comment.author: 59406631@N05
comment._content: Mwalimu Nyerere and British Colonial officers. Possibly Amir Jamal, the first Finance Minister of independent Tanganyika in the righ hand background.

comment.author: 67127882@N07
comment._content: The British Secretary of State for the Colonies, the Rt. Hon. Ian Macleod, MP, on the second day of his first visit to Tanganyika, 18 December 1959, meets Tanganyika Government ministers and political leaders. Right to left, front row: Sir Ernest Vasey, Minister of Finance; Mr John Fletcher-Cooke,CMG, Deputy Governor; HE Sir Richard Turnbull,KCMG, Governor of Tanganyika; Mr Macleod; Mr Julius K Nyerere,the President of TANU; back row: Mr JSR Cole,QC, Attorney General ; Mr WBL Monson, Under--Secretary, Colonial Office; next two unknown; on right, behind Nyerere,  Mr Nsilo Swai (later a minister), and behind him Mr Amir Jamal, Minister of Urban Local Government and Works. .

comment.author: 17417540@N00
comment._content: In 1961 while I was a student at the University of Colorado in Boulder, Sir. John Fletcher Cook,, my major professor,  was knighted by the Queen of England
